other_tests.findings: Perineurial cyst (10 mm by 8 mm) at the T7–T8 level on the left side that became filled with contrast material.
A perineurial cystic lesion at the T7–T8 level on the left side, with 10 or more additional cysts between T2 and T10.
MRI revealed a lesion (10 mm in the greatest dimension) in the left T7–T8 neural foramen, causing mild expansion and remodeling of the foramen; consistent with a perineurial cyst.
Bilateral T7–T8 neural foraminal cysts measuring up to 8 mm and additional smaller foraminal lesions at T10–T11, T11–T12, T12–L1, and low cervical levels.
Cysts at T7 and T8 were partially drained and injected with fibrin sealant; immediate but partial relief of pain.
Revealed sacral cysts, considered to have caused sacral radicular symptoms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Revealed a total of 21 Tarlov cysts.
